page.title: 16BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {THE CLERK TO MARTON PARISH COUNCIL. The present clerk has held the post for just over ten years. He is a retired villager who spends approximately one day per week on council business. Although the post is not an honorary one, his salary is little more than pin money. His job includes secretarial and financial duties as well as keeping an eye on the village in general.He feels that his duties should also include lending a sympathetic ear to all the residents'problems, no matter how small.He welcomes the introduction of a 'question time' session for the general public at the end of each monthly council meeting. The clerk's particular interest is rambling,and as well as taking an active part in the local group he keeps an eye on the footpaths.
